thread.title: Arsene Wenger admits Arsenal could do with Jack Wilshere as he faces up to midfield injury crisis
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger admits Arsenal could do with Jack Wilshere as he faces up to midfield injury crisis

author: Alex Richards
title: Arsene Wenger admits Arsenal could do with Jack Wilshere as he faces up to midfield injury crisis

organizations.name: getty images) share get arsenal fc

text:
Sport Arsene Wenger admits Arsenal could do with Jack Wilshere as he faces up to midfield injury crisis The England midfielder is impressing on loan at Dean Court, while Arsenal could be without FIVE central midfielders for the trip to Chelsea Share Wilshere has impressed on loan at Bournemouth - Wenger could do with him now (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty Images) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsenal Wenger has admitted that he could do with Jack Wilshere back at Arsenal, given the Gunners' current injury problems. 
Wilshere is on a season-long loan at Bournemouth, from which Arsenal cannot recall the England midfielder. 
Ahead of their clash with Premier League leaders Chelsea on Saturday, Wenger is currently dealing with an injury crisis at the heart of his midfield. 
Francis Coquelin has a hamstring problem and is a doubt, Aaron Ramsey has a calf injury and will be sidelined for three weeks and Santi Cazorla is a long-term absentee. Aaron Ramsey is out injured again (Photo: Shaun Botterill) Coquelin is an injury worry (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Aaron Ramsey out for three weeks 
Additionally, Granit Xhaka is serving a four-game suspension and Mohamed Elneny remains at the Africa Cup of Nations. 
That leaves youngster Ainsley Maitland-Niles set to start his first Premier League game at Stamford Bridge, leaving Wenger to appreciate that he is facing the consequences of allowing Wilshere to leave for regular action. Wilshere has been a regular for the Cherries (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Arsene Wenger admits he wanted N'Golo Kante last summer 
“We have agreed for Wilshere to go for one year on loan, we will accept that,” Wenger said. "I would like to reiterate that we didn’t push him out. He wanted to go somewhere and play and I agreed with that. 
“He wanted to go because he saw the level of the competitive players we had in midfield and let’s not forget we have as well Xhaka suspended, so there’s a huge level of competition. 
"I accepted to let him go and we have to deal with the consequences of that.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
